Class Sort

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sort

  • public class Sort
extends java.lang.Object
    Author - Tyler Wilding Description - Empirical Analysis of several sorting functions. TODO - Hoare Quicksort, Radix Sort

      • resetCounters

        public static void resetCounters()
        Quick method to reset the global variables for each test.

      • testAlgorithms

        public static void testAlgorithms(java.lang.String arrayType,
                                  int arraySize,
                                  int iterations)
        Testing method to automate testing and averaging results on each sorting algorithm.
        Parameters:
        arrayType - Whether or not the array should be ascending, descending, or random order.
        arraySize - Number of elements in the array.
        iterations - Number of tests to run per sorting algorithm to calculate the average.

      • heapSort

        public static int[] heapSort(int[] uArr)
        Main heapsort function.
        Parameters:
        uArr - Unsorted array that is a heap during sorting.
        Returns:
        The sorted array.

      • heapify

        public static int[] heapify(int[] uArr,
                            int i,
                            int endOfHeap)
        Rebuilds the array back into a max heap.
        Parameters:
        uArr - Unsorted Array, now a heap.
        i - Current root node we are looking at
        endOfHeap - Total elements that are not sorted in the array
        Returns:
        Heap as an integer array.

      • quickSortHelper

        public static int[] quickSortHelper(int[] uArr)
        Quick method to easily call quicksort and collect empirical analysis on it.
        Parameters:
        uArr - Unsorted Array
        Returns:
        Sorted integer array.

      • quickSort

        public static int[] quickSort(int[] uArr,
                              int lowBound,
                              int highBound)
        Quicksort Method
        Parameters:
        uArr - Full unsorted array
        lowBound - Beginning of the partion (assuming 0 based)
        highBound - End of the partiton (for example length-1)
        Returns:
        The sorted array.

      • partitionArray

        public static int partitionArray(int[] arr,
                                 int lowBound,
                                 int highBound)
        Quicksort partition scheme using Lomento's Pivot Selection
        Parameters:
        arr - Full unsorted array
        lowBound - Beginning of the partition (assuming 0 based)
        highBound - End of the partition (for example length-1)
        Returns:
        The new pivot's position

      • mergeSortHelper

        public static int[] mergeSortHelper(int[] uArr)
        Quick method to easily call mergesort and collect empirical analysis on it.
        Parameters:
        uArr - Unsorted Array
        Returns:
        Sorted integer array.

      • mergeSort

        public static int[] mergeSort(int[] mArr)
        Performs an merge sort on a given array, will also calculate the execution time, number of swaps, comparisons and array accesses
        Parameters:
        mArr - The unsorted array
        Returns:
        The sorted array

      • merge

        public static int[] merge(int[] aArr,
                          int[] bArr)
        Merges 2 unsorted integers arrays into a combined sorted array
        Parameters:
        aArr - First array
        bArr - Second array
        Returns:
        Combined sorted array.

      • selectionSort

        public static int[] selectionSort(int[] uArray)
        Performs an insertion sort on a given array, will also calculate the execution time, number of swaps, comparisons and array accesses
        Parameters:
        uArray - The unsorted int array
        Returns:
        The sorted array

      • insertionSort

        public static int[] insertionSort(int[] uArray)
        Performs an insertion sort on a given array, will also calculate the execution time, number of swaps, comparisons and array accesses
        Parameters:
        uArray - The unsorted int array
        Returns:
        The sorted array.

      • verifySorted

        public static boolean verifySorted(int[] sArray)
        Quick method to verify that the array is sorted, useful for testing.
        Parameters:
        sArray - Potentially sorted integer array
        Returns:
        True or false if sorted.

      • generateArray

        public static int[] generateArray(java.lang.String args,
                                  int size)
        Generates and returns an int array filled with a specified amount of elements in a particle ordering scheme
        Parameters:
        args - "sorted" for a sorted array in ascending order 1,2,3,4..."decreasing" for descending order, and anything else for random order.
        size - Number of elements in the array.
        Returns:
        The generated array as an int[]
